intro: Pisonia praecox, commonly known as the early pisonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a red or purple calyx. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface. Pisonia praecox thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
